incidents.name: AKS and RTF Interoperability issue

incident_updates.body: The new images are now available.

RTF customers running Mule workloads on self-managed Azure (AKS) platforms are advised to not upgrade their kubernetes infrastructure to version k8s1.25 due to a known cgroupsv2 interoperability issue with JDK8 used in the Runtimes. We will notify when a Mule Runtime update with the appropriate patch for this interoperability issue is available.

incidents.name: Shared spaces issue with CloudHub2.0 in us-east-2

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_CloudHub 2.0 US East \(Ohio\) Shared space unavailable in the US region - May 25 2023_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/CloudHub-2-0-US-East-Ohio-Shared-space-unavailable-in-the-US-region-May-25-2023)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._

As of 12:00 PM PT we are declared this issue as resolved, we reiterate our commitment to our customers and will be providing an RCA via our Help center in the next days.

Once more, we appreciate your patience.

We finished processing all data and all CloudHub 2.0 applications in the  us-east-2(Ohio) region should be fully operational, if you are experiencing problems feel free to reach out to support.

Once more we appreciate your patience during this issue.

A high percentage of applications are back online for CloudHub 2.0 customers in the us-east-2(Ohio) region, our internal systems are processing all the data to complete this task, we appreciate your patience while we work to fully restore the applications.

The process to bring back applications is still working, CloudHub 2.0 customers with applications in the us-east-2 (Ohio) region will see more applications coming back online, we are actively working towards fully resolution.

Thanks for your patience.

More applications are coming back online, CloudHub 2.0 customers with applications in the shared space us-east-2 (Ohio) will see recoveries, we are still working on making sure all applications are back online.

Thank you for patience while we continue working on this issue.

Some customers will start seeing their CloudHub 2.0 applications coming back online, we are verifying all deployments and progressing on making available all impacted applications.
This issue only impacted the CloudHub 2.0 shared space in the us-east-2 (Ohio) region.

Thank you for your patience while we continue working on restoring the applications.

While we continue working on redeploying the inaccessible applications we are doing validations, this is adding some extra time at the top of the redeployments, we will send a new update in the next 2 hours.

We appreciate your patience while we work on restoring the affected applications

We are now redeploying the inaccessible applications in order to return them to their normal operating state.  This is a time consuming process and will continue for some time, we will post another update in approximately 2 hours.

We continue to work diligently to restore all of the inaccessible applications to their normal operating state.

Thank you

We have made a proactive communication via email to potentially impacted users.

Our team is continuing to work diligently and have a path to return the remaining inaccessible applications to their normal operating state.

Thank you for your support while we continue to address this issue.

The inaccessible applications have been fully identified and data has been restored, we are now in the process of building out and relaunching the inaccessible applications.  This will take sometime and we will update you on our progress in approximately one hour.

Thank you again for your patience as we get the inaccessible applications back to their normal operational state.

As we continue our ongoing efforts to restore the us-east-2(Ohio), we want to call out that our suggested work-around does require that you understand your applications behavior.  We are working to return the currently inaccessible apps to their working state.  Once this is done, if you have launched your app in another region both applications may be running at the same time.  The impact of this can only be evaluated by your staff.  Please take this into consideration going forward.

In our previous update where we referenced creating a support case, if warranted by your business impact please make that an S1 case.

We appreciate your patience as we continue to work to restore the inaccessible applications

We are continuing our efforts to return the inaccessible applications to their normal operating state. If you are impacted and a Titanium or Platinum customer with global deployment you can deploy your applications to another region, if your architecture allows it. For Gold customers if your business is impacted you will need to create a support case referencing incident-52198963 and our support staff will work to change your default region to a workable option for you.

Thank you for your patience as our staff continues their work.

The issue with the CloudHub 2.0 shared space in the us-east-2 (Ohio) region has been identified. Unfortunately, a subset of customer applications is currently inaccessible. Rest assured, we are actively working on resolving the issue and bringing the impacted applications back to their normal operating state.
We are currently investigating an issue with CH2.0 shared spaces in us-east-2

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
As of 13:19 (PT) the issue has been resolved.  We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.
Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.
Customers will experience Runtime Manager not loading. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Mule runtime from April causing some issues

incident_updates.body: The new Mule Runtime release for May addresses the performance problems that were identified in the April release, customers can safely adopt the newer May release. If you need further assistance, please submit a ticket via our Help Center

MuleSoft engineering is working on an issue related with the April release of our Mule Runtime, if you are running the April Mule Runtime release and you are experiencing issues, please follow the workaround provided here  [Requires login]:
https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Degraded-Performance-in-CloudHub-Resource-Intensive-Applications-Utilizing-the-April-2023-Runtime-Release  
We are working on a permanent solution to this issue.

incidents.name: Anypoint Platform Release and Maintenance Window Extended

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_Mulesoft Composer and Mulesoft Composer for Salesforce Extended Release Window for US - 21st Jan 2023_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Mulesoft-Composer-and-Mulesoft-Composer-for-Salesforce-Extended-Release-Window-for-US)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
This incident has been resolved.

The widow for the US Anypoint Platform release has been extended. The following services will be impacted: *** Service Impact Details: ** Applications: Mulesoft Composer and Mulesoft Composer for Salesforce During Maintenance Downtime: * User Experience(UX): Composer UI will remain accessible, Composer customers will not be able to activate new flows, existing flows will be paused for time of infrastructure upgrade and may be inaccessible (showing "Activating" or "Deactivating" in UI) during maintenance window. Some flows will be impacted with temporary connectivity issues that will be restored after the maintenance window is closed. All flows will resume normal operations, however the failures will be reported in flow Run History for time of maintenance. If you subscribed for error notifications you may receive emails about failures that can be safely ignored if received during the maintenance window.

incidents.name: MuleSoft Support Center inaccessible

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are currently experience issues with the help.mulesoft.com site. Customers may not be able to view tiles on their support page in help center and create new support cases.

Customers wanting to create a new Customer Support case should follow the steps below:

1. Login to Support Center.
2. Use this link to access the case creation form https://help.mulesoft.com/s/contactsupport
3. Use the case link found in your case email notifications to access and update the case ticket.

incidents.name: Anypoint Platform OKTA SSO Login Failures

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

On 25 March 2022, the Third Party Vendor OKTA made a change in their “MuleSoft - Anypoint Platform” pre-built application. This has caused the SSO integration between OKTA and Anypoint Platform to fail. If you are impacted by this issue, please follow the instructions in this knowledge base article: https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Anypoint-Platform-SSO-login-is-not-working-when-using-prebuilt-App-in-OKTA

incidents.name: ACP alerting system is currently not working

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
Deploying a fix to in order to work current backlog without impacting customers on delayed events. Some customers might get duplicated alerts.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
The team is doing everything possible to correct the situation. Updates will follow, this is our top priority for customers.

incidents.name: Anypoint SSO Errors

incident_updates.body: The issue has been closed. The problem was determined to be a single IDP resulting from a change that the IDP made on their system and was not a MuleSoft Anypoint Platform issue.. Mulesoft Customers who are impacted can follow the Knowledge Article (https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Anypoint-Platform-SSO-login-is-not-working-when-using-prebuilt-App-in-OKTA) to correct the issue.
The problem has been isolated to a single IDP provider and we are working with them to develop a work around.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: RTF Clusters showing Status Degraded

incident_updates.body:
Our commitment to you:

We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business.  It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible.

Root Cause Analysis Document Link: [https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/RTF-instances-appeared-as-Degraded-due-to-upcoming-Certificate-expiration-Feb-11th-2022](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/RTF-instances-appeared-as-Degraded-due-to-upcoming-Certificate-expiration-Feb-11th-2022)

If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal.

The issue has been resolved, an automated job will clean this up for all Runtime Fabric customers on Sunday, customers can also self serve and clean this up following the instructions in the following KB article: https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/RTF-Degraded-Due-to-Client-Certificate-Expires-in-28-Days
This UI warning didn't cause any problem or degradation in customer runtimes nor Anypoint Control plane.

Engineering teams have found the problem and they are working on resolution, Runtime Fabric is not degraded and applications are not impacted, this is a UI warning with no impact to Runtimes or Control Plane.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Customers can expect a "Status Degraded" message related to future client certificate expiry in the RTF UI. This should not impact any application deployments. 
The team is investigating this issue. Until the issue is resolved, please do not perform RTF upgrades.

incidents.name: Apache Log4j2 vulnerability

incident_updates.body: Please see our Knowledge Article (https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Apache-Log4j2-vulnerability-December-2021) for latest updates

Following our vulnerability management process, MuleSoft is responding to the recent vulnerabilities announced in CVE-2021-4104, CVE-2021-45046, and CVE-2021-45105.

We have revised our CloudHub monthly patching schedule. Please see our Knowledge Article (https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Apache-Log4j2-vulnerability-December-2021) for latest updates.

Following our vulnerability management process, MuleSoft is responding to the recent vulnerabilities announced in CVE-2021-4104 and CVE-2021-45046 and CVE-2021-45105.

Please see our Knowledge Article (https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Apache-Log4j2-vulnerability-December-2021) for latest updates

MuleSoft (Cloud) is reported to be affected by CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2021-45046. MuleSoft services, including dataloader.io, have been updated to mitigate the issues currently identified in CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2021-45046, and we are executing our final validation steps. Please see our Knowledge Article (https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Apache-Log4j2-vulnerability-December-2021) for more information.

Following our vulnerability management process, MuleSoft is responding to the recent vulnerabilities announced in CVE-2021-4104 and CVE-2021-45046 and CVE-2021-45105. We are aware of the recent updates made by Apache concerning CVE-2021-45046 and are investigating. Updates have been posted to our Knowledge Article (​​https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Apache-Log4j2-vulnerability-December-2021 ). Please continue to monitor this status page for updates.

Following our vulnerability management process, MuleSoft is responding to the recent vulnerabilities announced in CVE-2021-4104 and CVE-2021-45046. We are aware of the recent updates made by Apache concerning CVE-2021-45046 and are investigating. Updates have been posted to our Knowledge Article (​​https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Apache-Log4j2-vulnerability-December-2021 ). Please continue to monitor this status page for updates.
We are aware of and monitoring CVE-2021-45046 as part of our ongoing investigation into the Apache Log4j2 vulnerability. Please continue to review the Knowledge Article for updates.

Please refer to the following Knowledge Article [Login Required] (https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Apache-Log4j2-vulnerability-December-2021) which will be updated as additional information becomes available.

Updated to the correct link.

Please refer to the following Knowledge Article [Login Required] (https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Apache-Log4j2-vulnerability-December-2021) which will be updated as additional information becomes available.

Issue: At MuleSoft, Trust is our #1 value, and we take the protection of our customers’ data very seriously. We are aware of the recently disclosed Apache Log4j2 (https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2021-44228) vulnerability.


Impact: We are actively monitoring this issue, and are working to patch any Salesforce services that either use the vulnerable component Log4j2 or provide it to customers.


For more information, please review CVE-2021-44228 (https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2021-44228) and the Apache Log4j2 (https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2021-44228) post. We appreciate your trust in us as we continue to make your success our top priority.

Next Update: Updates will be posted to the incident thread as additional information becomes available https://status.mulesoft.com/

incidents.name: RTF Clusters failing to forward logs into Anypoint Monitoring

incident_updates.body:
The team has resolved the logging issue for Runtime Fabric. The fix is released for all Supported Mule Runtime versions.
MuleSoft highly recommends updating their RTF runtimes to the latest release. Please refer to the Knowledge Article for further information. https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Logs-of-Mule-applications-running-in-Runtime-Fabric-are-not-visible-in-Anypoint-Monitoring-during-the-last-week-of-December-2021. An RCA will be available in 5 business days.

A fix has been released for 4.4.0, 4.3.0, 4.2.2, 4.2.1, and 3.9.5 versions of runtimes. Therefore, we recommend that customers upgrade their applications in the above runtime versions to the latest release to resolve this issue.  The team continues to work on releasing the fix for all other supported runtime versions, and the status page will be updated once the fix is available.  The next update will be in approximately 2 hours.
The team continues to work to implement the fix. The next update will be in approximately 2 hours.
The team has identified the root cause and continues to work on the fix.  The next update will be in approximately 2 hours.
The issue has been identified and Engineers are currently working on a fix.
Engineers are putting together a query to help isolate the cause, in efforts of mitigating the issue.
Engineers are still investigating the trigger/cause of the issue and are currently in a trouble-shooting call session.
As Engineers continue to investigate, we have been able to establish/verify that the logs are being generated and available for search.

Engineering teams continue to investigate in an effort to isolate the cause/trigger of the issue, we are walking through the data-flow to identify where we might have a potential gap(s) that might be affecting the log-pulls to the UI.
MuleSoft is aware of a problem on Runtime Fabric limited to log retrieval as apps are working as expected, Engineering teams are currently investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Customer may experience time out errors accessing Anypoint Platform

incident_updates.body: AWS has resolved the issue. We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.
We are continuing to monitor the situation. While the MuleSoft services are in recovering state, it's important to be aware that the AWS outage is still ongoing with active recovery efforts.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues, and are working with AWS for updates on their outage.

We have confirmed that the ongoing AWS outage is the culprit for the degraded performance. MuleSoft Engineering teams will continue to monitor the situation, and will provide updates as soon as they are available.

While MuleSoft dependencies repository is back up and running, we are investigating and monitoring for potential issues related to load balancers and APIs. MuleSoft engineering teams are continuing to investigate.

We have confirmed that MuleSoft dependencies repository with are back online. We are investigating the consequences of the service degradation and monitoring to ensure that impact is, in fact, resolved
We have confirmed that Nexus is back online. We are investigating the consequences of the service degradation and monitoring to ensure that impact is, in fact, resolved

Customer may experience time out errors accessing Anypoint Platform & when using Maven to resolve MuleSoft dependencies.

We are working with our upstream provider to resolve the issue.

Customers on Runtime Fabric may hit a space limit and the applications will stop.  Customer should not restart their applications or deploy new applications if they are on Runtime Fabric to avoid applying this new setting.

incidents.name: Customer will see a delay in the API Analytics and errors from API Manager

incident_updates.body: We have resolved the issue. We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.

The services are back online. We are investigating the consequences of the service outage and monitoring recovery.  

Analytics -  The service is working as expected. It will take about 6 hours to clear the backlog of data processing. 

API Manager - The service is working as expected. The Runtimes should be able to download policies with no errors. 
However, it can take up to three hours for any new changes on existing policy in API Manager to be reflected on the Runtime. As a workaround, disabling and enabling the policy would make the change immediately.

The team continues to investigate the issue. It is recommended that the customer not restart their applications. Running applications are not impacted. Customers will see a delay for approximately 12 hours on dashboards or reports for the API alerts and Analytics. Customers may observe errors while deploying policies & experience 'Read Time Out' errors during keep-alive with the API Manager.

The team continues to investigate the issue.  It is recommended that the customer not restart their applications.   Running applications are not impacted.  Customers will see a delay for approximately 5 hours on dashboards or reports for the API alerts and Analytics. Customers may see Read Time Out errors.
Customers will see a delay for about 4 hours on dashboards or reports for the API alerts and Analytics. Customers may see Read Time Out errors. Running applications are not impacted.
Customers will see a delay for about 3 hours on dashboards or reports for the API alerts and Analytics. Customers may see Read Time Out errors. Running applications are not impacted.
Customers will see a delay for about 2 hours on dashboards or reports for the API alerts and Analytics.  Customers may see Read Time Out errors.  Running applications are not impacted.
Customers will see a delay for about 1.5 hours on dashboards or reports for the API alerts and Analytics.  Customers may see Read Time Out errors.  Running applications are not impacted.
